from the Chris Christie 's Mansion "Given what I also considered the long odds against Mike Pence winning the presidential contest, I think he has made the right call," National Review's Rick Santorum Hood counters. As Daniels, Chris Christie , and others are in the midst of demonstrating, the post of governor is an excellent place to showcase the promise and importance of conservative governance-- and to hone the leadership and management skills that future chief executives need to be effective. Kathryn Jean Lopez says, also at National Review.Others close to the draft movement admit to be in a "funk' about Mike Pence 's decision. One stating:` Seriously, we have no one for 2012 now."

Jackie Walorski said she expected Mike Pence to abide by Mitch Daniels ' wishes. He and I are aligned virtually down the line on conservative and fiscal issues. I'm excited for any door Mike Pence walks through, she said. "Obviously it'd be great for the state of Indiana." Some engineers seem to be drawn by the work at a smaller company, which offers an opportunity to reshape culture with less corporate bureaucracy and more creative freedom. Facebook has become the cool kid on the block, and now Google Inc. wants to prove it can still be cool, too, said Danny Sullivan , who follows both companies closely as editor-in-chief of Search Engine Land. there are few numbers more misleading and misused than the average benefit for retirees of the California Public Employees' Retirement Association. CalPERS loves to circulate the statistic. So do politicians and unions representing workers. Twenty-five hundred dollars a month is the average state employee pension, state Treasurer Bill Lockyer , a member of the CalPERS board, told a UC Berkeley conference of academics and journalists last month. -- is he retiring from show business, or he is just leaving Live? Joking that he had a drink before he made the announcement, he asked David Letterman what he said. Then he explained, I'm leaving the show. I'm not retiring from show business. David Letterman asked Regis Philbin if he would come on show, at least.
